str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Next in order, the next day, the following day, at the period immediately following. From echo; successive.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: From kata and erchomai; to come down.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A mountain, hill. Probably from an obsolete oro; a mountain: -hill, mount(-ain).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To meet, encounter, fall in with. From sun and a derivative of anti; to meet with; figuratively, to occur.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.
